title: Very good!
text:
The hotel is a really nice bussiness option. Conveniently located next to the bus station. Nice, modern rooms. Very clean. Polite staff. Average breakfast.
As a Hilton memeber I wrote them 2 mails previous to coming that they never answered. I didnt mind, but it would be useful to upgrade that kind of communication.

title: Looking forward on getting back!
text:
Excellenty located hotel in the center of Zagreb. Really nicely decorated with spatious rooms equipped with everything you might need.
Nice, cozy lobby with a bar. Polite and welcoming staff.
Will be coming back.
place: Canopy by Hilton Zagreb City Centre

title: Tipical Italian hotel
text:
The hotel could definitely use some serious refurbishment. Rooms are pretty big compared to other Italian hotels and the hotel is nicely located in the centre of the city and close to the train.
Very poor breakfast, nice coffee at the bar. Polite owners.
Otherwise it i a basic hotel only for a quick sleepover.

title: Love it!
text:
We went two days in a row. Just a perfect place for breakfast.
Amazing coffee. Fresh and warm bread and croissants.
A variety of sweet and salty options.
Attentive staff.
Good prices for a central position.

title: Star!
text:
Excellent 5 course tasting menu. Very attentive and polite staff.
For a Michelin star restaurant decently priced.
Not too fancy and you feel very at ease being there.
Warm welcome.
I would definitely go back!

title: Greek mezas at their best!
text:
It is hectic, busy, crowded and just perfect. It is all that you would expect from an authentic Greek restaurant.

Try all the mezas and the authentic desserts.

Nice and polite service. Excellent prices. Perfect position.

title: Go!
text: An amazing museum that tells you a rich story of the amazing Greek history. You could spend days in it. Wonderful restaurant inside and a lovely souvenir shop.

title: Amazing!
text:
Just amazing! A definite must. You feel like the history of the world is in this place.

Wear comfortable shoes and take some water. Fully charge your mobile phone for some excellent photos.

title: Do not miss!
text:
Lovely Greek bar, nicely situated and perfectly decorated in the city center.

You get the feeling of a local having your coffee in this bar.

Try coming early, because it is not overcrowded then. Very cozy. Nice for athentic photos.

title: Greek experience!
text:
Ella offered a real Greek food experience. The food was excellent. From the mezas, olives, gyros and kebab. There was not one fault in any of them.
Our waitor was really polite, friendly and spoke good English.

The restaurant is located in the city center, near to the main square. Value for money, definitely.
It is a 4* review, because (having an online reservation) we would have appreciated to have been seated in the front side of the restaurant, which is much nicer, then the street aside.

title: The dessert!
text:
The restaurant is located in the city center, just a couple of minutes away from the Syntagma Square.

It has an "italian touch" though it is completely Greek. Perfect ambiance with very polite English knowing staff.

The food was amazing. Whatever you get, I am certain it is gonna be good.

Do not miss the traditional desserts, they are a must.

Good variety of wines.

It is also a shop where you can get most of the things that you had tried,

Definitely value for money.

title: Just perfect!
text:
A wonderful hotel. Nicely located just 15 minutes walking to the Syntagma Square. The metro from the airport coveniently leaves you just in front of the hotel.

The hotel has a really nice lobby and perfect rooms with all the amenities.
The staff is extremly polite with good English.

Breakfast is very rich and tasty.

The Galaxy bar on the top of the hotel is a must. Excellent coctails with amazing view of the Acropolis.

This hotel would always be my choice.

title: Just great!
text:
Kate was just great taking us to the Acropolis and through the Acropolis Museum. You can feel that she is a local by the way she explains the rich Greek history, with knowledge and lots of love. All the questions of our group were answered to detail and on a very interesting way.
Though the tour lasts for almost 4 hours, it passed too quick.
The group size was perfect, as was the pace of the tour.
Wear comfortable shoes, take water, and definitely do this tour!

Thanks, Katarina!
place: The Acropolis, Athens Walking City Tour and Acropolis Museum

title: Italy in Poland
text:
Really nice restoran in center of Krakow. Though it is an Italian restaurant there is a nice selection of different types of food. We had an excellent tuna sashimi and a version of a parmigiana with vegetables. Excellent tiramisu to end the meal.
There is an excellent variety of wines to pair with your food.
The service is ok, a bit cold, as in rest of Poland.
Not cheap.

title: Nice hotel!
text:
The hotel is conveniently located, walking distance from the center.
The rooms are big and clean. The bathroom is well equipped, though the hairdryer is pretty weak. Prices are decent.
Breakfast is ok. The staff is a bit "cold".
All in all it was a good stay.

title: See you in August!
text:
Well, it was good enough that I will be coming back in August with my family.
A bit of beaten path but in a nice, noncrowdy part of Venice.
Good variety of Italian dishes, nice desserts and polite staff.
Not cheap, but definitely value for money.

title: A good one!
text:
A decent hotel outside of Venice. Big and clean rooms. Strong WIFI.
Very polite staff. The breakfast is ok, though at one point there were too many people at one place, too early in the morning.
Central Venice is around 30 minutes away. Airport is very close.
The hotel has good prices.
Convenient for a bussiness trip.
Parking available.
place: Best Western Plus Quid Hotel Venice Mestre

title: Amazing steak!
text:
Nicely decorated small restaurant close to Oxford street and Hyde park. Little gem for meat lovers. Excellent steak. Good choice of wines and coctails. Attentive service.

Value for money. Go with the Argetinian meat :).

title: Tutto bene!
text:
It is an excellent Italian restaurant in London. The location is easy accessible and a reservation is a must.

The restaurant is nicely decorated in a modern way, though the chairs could be a bit more comfortable and for the price you pay here the tables should be a bit more separated. But those are the details...

The food is amazing. From the homemade bread, excellent olive oil and amazing pasta and risotto.

Tiramisu is a must. Attentive staff and excellent choice of wines.

Pretty pricey. But worth it.

title: Very good.
text:
The hotel is conveniently located at Paddington station. Good for metro, buses, taxy or walkers. Oxford street is just around the corner. And it is an excellent area full of restaurants.

Rooms are spatious and clean. They are equippped with everything you might need.
The breakfast is ok.

Staff is very, very polite and helpfull.

The hotel could use some refurbishing, but it is a good one!

title: Tutto bene!
text:
An excellent Italian restaurant in BH.
Conveniently located in the city and really nicely decorated. The staff ia more than polite and very friendly.

Though we arrived very late, they served us very professionally.

The food is excellent. Real Italian taste.
Decently priced.

Do not miss the chocolate lava cake!

title: Solid
text:
The hotel is perfectly located in the center of BH. It has big and spatious rooms with everything you might need.
The breakfast is good with various possibilities.

The hotel capacities are clean.
Unfortunately very rare staff members speak anything but English.

title: Pretty bad
text:
The airplane had just arrived and it was inmediately organized for another flight. Meaning, it was not cleansed at all. Garbage all over.
No food or water is included in the price of the ticket. That is ok if you get an opportunity to buy a sandwich. But if you are in the last row the sandwiches are sold and you end up with chips. Not a good experience, especially when you are flying with children.

title: Sirlione!
text:
If you are a meat lover this is definitely a really good place for some good meat. But you can also get some good pizza and salads inside.
It is a small restaurant and booking before is a good idea.
The staff is polite. The prices are reasonable.
Go with the classics- a sirlione and a sangria. You will not be wrong.

title: A classic moneyspender
text: It is like Oxford street. Busy, live and tempting. The perfect place to spend some money and have some drinks.

title: Roayal adventure
text:
Walking through you just get the feeling of the great tradition and strength that Spain had and has, Really beautiful palace.
Buy tickets online.

title: A must!
text: It is so rich and beautiful that you need at least a day to spend inside. Rubens, Goya, Velasquez and many more will just amaze you.

title: Relaxing
text: A beautiful getaway in the heart of Madrid. Really nice and spatious park where you can just or sit or take photos.

title: Perfetto!
text:
Though in Madrid this is a perfect Italian getaway in the heart of Spain. Really nicely decorated restaurant very close to Porta del Sol, where you will need a reservation.
Very polite and knowledgaable staff with a smile.
We were a group of 6 with 3 children included and we loved everything! From the parmigiana to the homemade pasta. Ask a recommendation for the red wine and you will be more than happy.
Do not forget to end with tiramisu and panna cota.The prices are decent and there is WIFI.
Our kids said this is a 10* restaurant! Definitely is.
Hope to come back sometime.

title: Rainy tour
text:
It was 'falling cats and dogs' but we somehow managed to survive the tour and though souking wet come to its end.
Bram spoke perfect English, he was witty and intelligent.
It was a tip based tour. And we were a small group, which was very convenient. Due to the weather conditions we were given umbrellas.

title: Cozy
text:
The hotel is nicely located in the quiet heart of the Museum area. 20 minutes walking distance from the Dam.
We booked 2 rooms, 3 persons each. Not a good solution. Tiny rooms, miniature bathrooms, not convenient at all for 3 persons. Though the rooms were clean and the beds comfortable.
The brekfast was basic and the.service was ok. WIFI functioned perfectly, as did the elevator so we did not have problems with steep steps.
The hotel is cozy, but a bit overpriced for what you get.

title: Pizza 100%
text:
A pizza is always a good idea. Especially when in Rome. We had some excellent pizza here. The menu is rich and everybody can find something for themselves.
The place is centrally located next to Piazza de Popoli and a bit overcrowded. But we managed to sit without reservation (waited for 5 minutes).
Prices are more then decent. Service so so. We waited for the pizza much more then needed.

title: Quick entrance
text:
We did the Colosseum and Forum Romanum tour. The goal was to get us quickly inside and we achieved it. The lady guide was nice and polite and covered the Colloseum nicely. We moved among the masses easily. But getting into the Forum Romanum after 10 minutes we were left by ourselves. We hoped to hear a bit more even there, but unfortunately not.
There were 13 of us in the group and the price of the tour says 3.5 hours. Ours lasted 2.5 h.

title: OK.
text:
I have done a lot of free tours around Europe and this was not one of the best ones. It was obvious that Stefano definitely has knowledge but it did not seem as a concise tour. A lot of information at the same time, without the beginning and end.
Particular sense of humour especially with people from England (a bit over the edge).
Though I have been to Rome before, this was my first time on a tour and I have seen places I hadn't before, which was much appreciated. But some basics( for the first time visitors) were not covered.
All together, an ok tipped based tour.

title: Convenient location
text:
The location in this apartment is everything. Just next to Piazza di Popoli and Piazza Spagna. Perfect!
Otherwise. If you arrive after 7PM you have to pay an additional 30 euro and there is no reception.
The rooms look much better on the photos then in reality. They are pretty small and the bathroom is porely equipped (2 small shampoos for 2 people for 3 days?!?)
Small but comfortable bed.
It could be even a bit more cleaner.
You get your breakfast in a small bar on the opposite side of the apartment building. Very cozy with polite service.

Perfect WIFI.

It was value for money. Mainly because of the position.

title: Brilliant!
text:
This is one the best places I have eaten in Europe. Perfectly decorated and conviently located just next to Piazza di Popoli. Reservation is needed.
Excellent italian food with an accent on different types of truffles. Rich collection of wines. Awesome desserts.
The service is just perfect.
And not to spoil everything, there are even different kinds of suprises in this restaurant, but you will just have to go.
I am coming back definitely.

Prices... more value than money. :)

title: Good.
text:
It is a basic hotel. It has everything you need but nothing is above average.
Decent rooms, polite staff and a good breakfast. The location is not perfect, but it is ok. It is a bit noisy due to the fact it is at one of the main streets.

title: Nice hotel.
text:
The hotel is nicely located. Very close to the city center, but quiet.The rooms are big and spatious, as the bathroom is. Breakfast is really good and the service is polite.
The only thing which is a bit unconvenient is the fact that the hotel is dvivided into a couple of buildings so you can end up on the opposite side of the reception and the restaurant.
All in all a good stay.
place: Relais de la Malmaison Paris Rueil Hotel & Spa

title: Excellent!
text:
The position of the restaurant is perfect. Just above the Saplunara beach.
The food was excellent. From starters to the desert. Good wine and a very cozy traditional atmosphere.
The service is awesome. Polite and attentive staff.
Value for money.
I would definitely recommend thia restaurant to everybody and I will be coming back.
Take note that my criteria is high and I have eaten on very good and very bad places. ☆☆☆☆☆

title: Basic.
text:
Hard to find. Unpolite staff wiith very basic knowledge of any other language then Russian.
Basic room with a very small bathroom. Not very clean.
Nicely located and cheap for a sleepover. WIFI works well.

title: Very good!
text:
The restaurant is very nicely decorated, though located a bit away from the centre of the city (25min taxi drive). It has excellent Serbian cousine (meat is the highlight of everything) and extremly polite staff.
The prices are midrange, but definitely value for money.
The WIFI was working perfectly.

title: Sleepover.
text:
Being close to the airport it is a very convenient place for a sleepover. A bus shuttle will take you there for free. Clean and comfortable rooms with equipped bathroom. Very polite staff.
Value for money.

title: Pizza ***
text:
A bit owercrowded, but with nice and polite staff and overall the most important thing-excellent pizza! Naples has more than 500 pizzerias and this is a nice choice.
Decent prices and unfortunately a WIFI that does not function.

title: Excellent☆
text:
From the first contact everything was perfect. Very polite and quick mail communication. Everything arranged just like we wanted.
Our visit to Pompei was delightful. Charlotte, our guide was excellent! Ciro, our driver was very knowledgable, witty and shared a lot info about everyday Naples.

Planning to choose this company for our next visit!

title: Overrated!
text:
It is not the problem that we waited for our table for more than an hour...the problem is that when we were seated we waited more than 15 min to get the menu, then 10 more to order drinks, 10 more to get wrong drinks, and it continues....

The food was ok, I have eaten better and worse Italian. They have a small menu, and though it is to expect to have all the things offered served, that also did not happen.

Luck in it all is the fact the prices are more than affordable.

If they want to work well in the future, the first thing they should do is work on the level of service.

title: Good tour!
text:
My mother and I enjoyed the tour with
Silvia very much. She shared a lot with us about beautiful park Guell on a very interesting and pleasent way.

The fact that I could book on the spot just a bit before the tour is excellent, since there is no chance to get into the park (whenever you decide) without a prebooked ticket.

The price of 30 euro for a person for one hour is ok.

title: Excellent location!
text:
This B&B is located on an excellent locatio n in the heart of Barcelona.
We had a very small, pretty claustrofobic room with our own bathroom. The window did exist but there was no view, just noise from somewhere outside.

The bathroom amenities are ok, but nit changed freguently. Also, we got the shampoos half used.

They serve an excellent breakfast! Tasty and in a nice place.

The service is just ok. Nothing more. Could have been a bit more hospitable.

It felt like more money than value.

title: Viana is still #1 !
text:
This was my second time in Viana. Two years have passed and nothing has changed. Excellent service, perfect 5* food from starters to desert and always a good blueberry mojito.

There is absolutely no doubt why this restaurant is #1 in Barcelona.

Value for money and much more!

title: Ok.
text:
Well. For a 5* hotel I was expecting a bit more. The rooms are pretty old fashioned, the cleaning level could be a bit higher and the mini bar could be fuller.
The room was freezing cold when I arrived and the check in was a bit long.

The service is excellent and the breakfast ia also very good.

There is a nice bar in the lobby.

title: I❤HY36
text:
Loved it! Perfectly located just near the Times Square. Though the rooms are small, they are clean, tidy and modern, as the bathroom is.
Iron, hairdryer, tv, airconditioning and excellent wifi connection. There is everything.
If you are travelling from Europe no need for an adapter for your phone, usb available.
Polite and welcoming service. And the possibility of leaving luggage.
Excellent bar/restaurant as the part of the hotel.
Value for money, overall. And we were not sleeping 'with the view', but we loved it.
Hope to come back!

title: Good bussiness hotel
text:
Located near the airport. Easy connection. Spatious, tidy, clean room and bathroom.
Everything that you need; iron, hairdryer, usb (no need for adapters) and good wifi.
Nice service and a couple of breakfast possibilities as a part of the hotel. Parking available also.
Some of the rooms are noisy due to the airport.
All in all, good value for money.
place: H Hotel Los Angeles, Curio Collection by Hilton

title: Good.
text:
The hotel is nicely located.
Big, spatious rooms and free wifi.
Not very clean and a bit noisy.
The service is polite though it gets very busy at the reception.
Average breakfast.
Payed garage available.
place: Hyatt Place Washington D.C. National Mall

title: The steak!
text:
Located near to the Times Square.
Nice atmospfere. Very cozy.
Excellent steak. Excellent! But also good selection of fish.
Nice coctails and very polite, witty staff.
This definitely should be a place to visit.
It is not cheap, but it is value for money.

title: Calmfull hotel
text:
Nicely located and fully equipped hotel.
The rooms are big and spatious as the bathroom is. Everything is clean and tidy.
The rooms have an iron, hairdryer and good wifi. No need for adapters, you can charge your phone on usb.
Polite service and beutiful reception.
Excellent breakfast.
place: Portola Hotel & Spa at Monterey Bay

title: Super!
text:
Awesome experience. Especially for kids.
Modern aquarium, beautifully located. Inner space offers everything you can imagine exists in the sea and is very nicely explained. Do not miss the penguins and the giant octopus!
Beautifull views from outside and places to sit and relax.

title: Perfect as Lisbon is!
text:
Small cosy restaurant, a bit off the track, but well worth it.
Awesome food! From the chicken pie to the cod fish. Everything on the menu is well worth trying.
Excellent porto, martini rosso and wine.
Nice service. Very, very affordable (dinner for 3 with wine 60 euro), and we are foodies.
Try not to miss this gem!

title: Perfection!
text: We ate the pasteis de nate all over Lisbon and yes we confirm; 'The ones in Pasteis de Belem are the best. Just perfect!'

title: Paradise for foodies.
text:
If you like to eat and drink well and at the same time feel the culture of another country, this is the place for you.
Perfect food and drinks on every corner.
Among different offers, Michelin star chefs offering there delights with affordable price.
Cod fish and tuna on million ways.
The best sangria I ever tasted.
Unfortunately we had too little time for everything.
An excellent lunch place.

title: Nice tour!
text:
Jorge was very good! Though it was raining throughout the whole tour he kept our attention and showed us the heart of the city with a lot of passion. He is a real storyteller.
It was a small group and it was a free tour based on tips.

title: Good hotel.
text: Hotel Weitzer is a centrally located hotel in Graz. Just a few minutes from the centre. Spatious rooms and bathroom.Rich and tasty breakfast. Polite service. Not over the top, but I definitely recommend it for a quick bussiness stay.
